The Federal Trade Commission will establish procedures within a year of this Act's enactment to log, acknowledge, and refer complaints from individuals who believe their identification has been unlawfully acquired. Informational materials will also be provided to these individuals. The Act authorizes the Federal Trade Commission to provide informational materials to individuals and refer complaints to appropriate entities, including national consumer reporting agencies and law enforcement agencies. REDACTION OF ETHICS REPORTS FILED BY JUDICIAL OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES. Section 105(b) of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 is amended to allow for redaction of reports filed by certain individuals if revealing personal information could endanger them. Redactions are only permitted to protect the individual and must be maintained as long as the danger exists. The Administrative Office of the United States Courts must submit an annual report to Congress regarding the redaction of reports filed by individuals to protect their safety. The report must include the total number of redacted reports, individuals affected, and types of threats faced. The Judicial Conference, in consultation with the Department of Justice, will issue regulations on redaction circumstances and procedures. This provision expires on December 31, 2001, and applies to filings through calendar year 2001.
